ray.rage.rendersystem.shader

Interface GpuShaderProgram

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGlslProgram, GlslRenderingProgram, GlslSkeletalRenderingProgram, GlslSkyBoxProgram, GlslTessProgram

    public interface GpuShaderProgram
extends Disposable
    A GPU shader program represents the modern programmable graphics pipeline.

    The modern shader-based pipeline is made of several programmable stages, some of which are required and some of which are optional. The minimum number of required stages are made of vertex and fragment programs, generally written in GLSL, which are compiled and linked (i.e. built) into a single object program that gets executed directly in the GPU. GPUs are often referred to as the "servers" while the applications running on the CPU are often referred to as "clients".

    Other than providing the source code for specific stages and basic setup, clients are not generally expected to work with shaders directly.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.Attribute<T>
      An input attribute.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.Context
      The context encapsulates all the objects whose information is needed by the program to execute properly.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.Input<T>
      An input expected by the program from clients.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.LocatableInput<T>
      A nameable input in the source code that is given a location ID at runtime by the underlying driver.
      static class  GpuShaderProgram.Stage
      The stage within the graphics pipeline that source code will be added for.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.StorageBuffer<T>
      A dynamic storage buffer for input data that receives a buffer ID at runtime by the underlying driver.
      static class  GpuShaderProgram.Type
      Used to determine which program will be created.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.Uniform<T>
      An input uniform.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        int getId()
        Gets the ID generated by the underlying driver for this program.
        Returns:
        The ID of this program.

      • getType

        GpuShaderProgram.Type getType()
        The type of this program.
        Returns:
        The type.

      • createContext

        GpuShaderProgram.Context createContext()
        Creates a new context usable by this program.
        Returns:
        A new context.

      • addSourceCode

        void addSourceCode(java.lang.String code,
                   GpuShaderProgram.Stage stage)
        Adds the specified source code string for the specified stage.
        Parameters:
        code - The source code to be built by the underlying driver implementation.
        stage - The stage this code is for.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the code string is empty.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.

      • build

        void build()
        Submits the source code to the driver so that it can get compiled and linked into an executable GpuShaderProgram.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the compilation or linking process fails, or if the program has been built already.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If required source code is missing for any of the required stages.
        See Also:
        addSourceCode(String, Stage)

      • bind

        void bind()
        Binds this program to make it active.

        The next renderable to be submitted to the pipeline will be processed by this instance. This step must be executed before fetching data.

      • fetch

        void fetch(GpuShaderProgram.Context ctx)
        Gets data from the context and submits it into the pipeline, in preparation for a command to draw the renderable.

        This step must be executed after binding data.

        Parameters:
        ctx - The context.

      • unbind

        void unbind()
        Unbinds this program.

        This step should be executed after the program has completed its execution.
